item.description:
One of our members, Dianne, suggested the following event. She is facilitating an introduction to the film as well as a discussion afterward.

See below:

At Real Art Ways on Monday, they will be showing the matinee film "The Four Hundred Blows" by Truffaut. It is a revered work in the history of film. It costs only $5 and includes a light lunch starting at 1:00.

There will be other Meetup people there and I'd appreciate it if you'd let other film fans know about this great event. I don't expect you to organize anything around it- just letting people know would be great.

From the Hartford Courant:

As a boy, Fran√ßois Truffaut went to the movies to forget his troubles. When he grew up, he made a movie about a boy who did the same thing.

"The 400 Blows" tells the story of Antoine, whose mother and stepfather have little time for him. His teachers dislike and distrust him, only with partial justification, and he has run-ins with police. Whenever he has the chance, he reads his beloved Balzac and goes to the movies, immersing himself in other people's lives.

Truffaut's classic will be shown Monday, Jan. 4, at Real Art Ways. It is 99 minutes, in French with subtitles and unrated. It will be shown at 1:30 p.m., preceded by a refreshment period and followed by a discussion.

Real Art Ways is at 56 Arbor St., Hartford. Admission is $5.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for each other in the lobby.
